{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amniotic fluid is mainly produced by the fetus. According to the documents, the fetal kidneys begin to function around week 16 and fetal urine contributes to the fluid. Additionally, during late gestation, fetal urine becomes the largest source of amniotic fluid. Other sources, such as lung secretions, gastrointestinal secretions, and excretions from the umbilical cord and placental surface, also contribute to the composition of amniotic fluid, but fetal urine is the primary source.", "answer_choice": "B"}
